S. Korean "National Assembly" Regarded as Most Corrupt Law-making�@Body 
    Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) --It was disclosed that the  south Korean people regard the "National Assembly" as the most corrupt law-making body, according to the south Korean MBC.
 This disclosure was made by the International Organization for Transparency, a non-governmental one, on Dec. 10 through the results of the survey conducted by it on the occasion of the "International Day against Corruption".    
 It is said that the people also consider political parties, police and the custom authorities as corrupt ones.

articles.title: Japan's Proper Liquidation of Its Sinful Past Demanded in S. Korea
articles.content:
Japan's Proper Liquidation of Its Sinful Past Demanded in S. Korea 
    Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- The Institute for National Studies and other civic and social organizations, the "National Assemblymen's Group for Correct Education in History" held a press conference at the building of the "National Assembly" on Dec. 8 demanding the Japanese government properly liquidate its sinful past, according to south Korean MBC.
 Those organizations said at the press conference that the Japanese government has worked hard to cover up its crimes through its moves to tamper with its history up to this date since the end of the Pacific War, far from making a proper apology and compensation for the victims of war including the "comfort women for the imperial Japanese army"  and victims of the forcible drafting. The bid made by Japan for the permanent membership of the UN Security Council before atoning for its sinful past and probing the truth about its crimes is arousing a serious concern, the organizations said, urging the Japanese government to opt for properly settling its sinful past as early as possible.

Film Show Held for Foreign Women
articles.content:
Film Show Held for Foreign Women 
    Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- A film show was held for women of foreign embassies and missions of international organizations here at the Taedonggang Club for the Diplomatic Corps on Dec. 16 on the occasion of the 87th birth anniversary of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk.
 Present there were Pak Sun Hui, chairwoman of the Central Committee of the Korean Democratic Women's Union, and officials concerned.    
 The participants watched the Korean feature film "On the Bank of the River Tuman."

Wreath Laid before Bust of Kim Jong Suk
articles.content:
Wreath Laid before Bust of Kim Jong Suk 
    Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- Women of foreign embassies and missions of international organizations here laid a wreath before the bust of anti-Japanese war hero Kim Jong Suk at the Revolutionary Martyrs' Cemetery on Mt. Taesong Thursday on the threshold of her 87th birth anniversary.
 They placed the wreath before her bust and observed a moment's silence in deepest reverence for Kim Jong Suk who was intensely loyal to President Kim Il Sung and devoted her precious life to the noble cause of the liberation and prosperity of the country and happiness of the people, true to his leadership.    
 Written on the ribbon of the wreath were words "The revolutionary feats performed by anti-Japanese war hero Comrade Kim Jong Suk will be immortal".

Kim Yong Nam Sends Congratulatory message to Ghanaian President
articles.content:
Kim Yong Nam Sends Congratulatory message to Ghanaian President
    Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a congratulatory message to Ghanaian President John Agyekum Kufuor upon his reelection as president of the Republic of Ghana.
 Expressing the belief that the excellent friendly and cooperative relations between the two countries would continue to develop favorably in the future, too, the message sincerely wished him greater success in his responsible work.

articles.title: Congratulatory Message to President of Niger
articles.content:
Congratulatory Message to President of Niger
    Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- Kim Yong Nam, president of the Presidium of the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly, Wednesday sent a congratulatory message to Mamadou Tandja upon his reelection as president of the Republic of Niger.
  The message expressed the belief that the friendly relations between the two countries would grow stronger, sincerely wishing him greater success in his work for the stability and prosperity of the country.

Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Thae Son Hui
articles.content:
Kim Jong Il Sends Wreath to Bier of Thae Son Hui
    Pyongyang, Pyongyang, December 17 (KCNA) -- Supreme Commander of the Korean People's Army Kim Jong Il today sent a wreath to the bier of the late General Officer of the KPA Thae Son Hui, deputy to the DPRK Supreme People's Assembly and hero of the Republic, expressing condolences over her death.
 She died of aplastic anemia at the age of 76 on December 16.    
 She bravely fought as an airwoman during the last Fatherland Liberation War fought to repel the U.S. imperialists' armed invasion and dedicated herself to her services in various fields of the KPA. true to the Songun revolutionary leadership of the Workers' Party of Korea .
